definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Should one renounce Nirvana oneself, in order to help others towards it first?
sentences.chinese: 人應該放棄自己的涅磐，爲了首先幫助它人達到它？

sentences.english: The failure to appreciate the iPhone was all mine.
sentences.chinese: 這個放棄欣賞iphone的行爲全是我自己的想法。

sentences.english: At what point does the RO decide to abandon in deteriorating weather conditions?
sentences.chinese: 天氣惡化時，裁判長在什麼時刻決定放棄競賽？

sentences.english: Never give up when you feel that you can keep giving.
sentences.chinese: 當你覺得希望尚存時，請不要放棄。

sentences.english: He expatriated himself and lives in America.
sentences.chinese: 他放棄原國籍，現居美國。

sentences.english: Both of you have to discard prejudices before reaching agreement.
sentences.chinese: 你們雙方只有放棄偏見才能達成一致。

sentences.english: They nix the idea upon learning that DHMO is actually water.
sentences.chinese: 在知道一氧化二氫其實是水以後他們放棄了這種想法。

sentences.english: Some of the farmers had quit farming and were cutting railroad ties so they could feed their families.
sentences.chinese: 有些農民放棄了耕作，靠砍伐鋪鐵路的枕木養家餬口。

sentences.english: Do not drop your determination which you wanted to just because of a casw of crabs.
sentences.chinese: 不要只因一次失敗，就放棄你原來決心想達到的目的。

sentences.english: Get your brand message out there and don’t waiver on it.
sentences.chinese: 傳遞你的品牌信息，別放棄。

sentences.english: To surrender means to give up half your wager and not complete the hand.
sentences.chinese: 投降就是放棄您一半的賭注同時放棄這局牌。

sentences.english: To surrender means to give up half your wager and not complete the hand.
sentences.chinese: 投降就是放棄您一半的賭注同時放棄這局牌。

sentences.english: You're throwing away the only life you're ever going to have.
sentences.chinese: 你放棄了你本可以繼續的唯一的生命。

sentences.english: But I would not give up for anything.
sentences.chinese: 我絕不會爲任何事情放棄。

sentences.english: And if so, how can you give up your desire for those things?
sentences.chinese: 如果是這樣，你又怎麼能放棄對這些東西的渴望呢？

sentences.english: I gave up after two or three visits because I found it hard to find the time.
sentences.chinese: 去了兩三次後我放棄了，因爲我抽不出時間。

definition: to decide (to do something)/to resolve/decision/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]/certainly
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
